metadata.title: CVE-2024-26603 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:x86/fpu: Stop relying on userspace for info to fault in xsave buffer Beforethis change, the expected size of the user space buffer was taken fromfx_sw->xstate_size. fx_sw->xstate_size can be changed from user-space, soit is possible construct a sigreturn frame where: * fx_sw->xstate_size issmaller than the size required by valid bits in fx_sw->xfeatures. *user-space unmaps parts of the sigrame fpu buffer so that not all of thebuffer required by xrstor is accessible. In this case, xrstor tries torestore and accesses the unmapped area which results in a fault. Butfault_in_readable succeeds because buf + fx_sw->xstate_size is within thestill mapped area, so it goes back and tries xrstor again. It will spin inthis loop forever. Instead, fault in the maximum size which can be touchedby XRSTOR (taken from fpstate->user_size). [ dhansen: tweak subject /changelog ]
